dt: {bc}to get {d_link|possession|possession} of (something) {bc}to obtain (something) by particular care and effort

dt.t: She had managed to {wi}procure{/wi} a hat shaped like a life-size lion's head, which was perched precariously on her head.

dt: {bc}to bring about or achieve (something) by care and effort

dt.t: was unable to {it}procure{/it} the prisoner's release

dt: {bc}to obtain (someone) to be employed for sex (as for an individual or in a house of prostitution)

dt.t: … accused of acting as a "madam" and "{wi}procuring{/wi} girls" for wealthy sex offender Epstein—claims that she strongly denies.
No one has been prosecuted … for pimping or {wi}procuring{/wi} …

quotes.t: Unlike an agent, whose chief task is to {qword}procure{/qword} acting roles and handle the legal negotiations of an actor's contract, a personal manager's influence is more pervasive …

He was stationed down in South Carolina about a year when he became engaged to an Irish Catholic girl whose father, a marine major and a one-time Purdue football coach, had {qword}procured{/qword} him the cushy job as drill instructor in order to keep him at Parris Island to play ball.
It was at that encounter in Pakistan that Faris was put in charge of {qword}procuring{/qword} acetylene torches to slice suspension cables, as well as torque tools to bend portions of train track.

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}procurer{/it}, from Late Latin {it}procurare{/it}, from Latin, to take care of, from {it}pro-{/it} for + {it}cura{/it} care
shortdef: to get possession of (something) : to obtain (something) by particular care and effort
to bring about or achieve (something) by care and effort
to obtain (someone) to be employed for sex (as for an individual or in a house of prostitution)
